Author: John
Sentence: The elder unto the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth; and not I only, but also all they that have known the truth;

Author: John
Sentence: For the truth’s sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us for ever.

Author: John
Sentence: Grace be with you, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

Author: John
Sentence: I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: And now I beseech thee, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment unto thee, but that which we had from the beginning, that we love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments.

Author: John
Sentence: This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

Author: John
Sentence: For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh.

Author: John
Sentence: This is a deceiver and an antichrist.

Author: John
Sentence: Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God.

Author: John
Sentence: He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.

Author: John
Sentence: If there come any unto you, and bring not this doctrine, receive him not into [your] house, neither bid him God speed:

Author: John
Sentence: For he that biddeth him God speed is partaker of his evil deeds.

Author: John
Sentence: Having many things to write unto you, I would not [write] with paper and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak face to face, that our joy may be full.

Author: John
Sentence: The children of thy elect sister greet thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

Author: John
Sentence: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

Author: John
Sentence: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

Author: John
Sentence: Because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

Author: John
Sentence: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

Author: John
Sentence: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth [them] out of the church.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good.

Author: John
Sentence: He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

Author: John
Sentence: Demetrius hath good report of all [men], and of the truth itself: yea, and we [also] bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

Author: John
Sentence: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:

Author: John
Sentence: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face.

Author: John
Sentence: Peace [be] to thee.

Author: John
Sentence: [Our] friends salute thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Greet the friends by name.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] to you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly [places] in Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; [even] in him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom ye also [trusted], after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And what [is] the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set [him] at his own right hand in the heavenly [places],

Author: Paul
Sentence: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And hath put all [things] under his feet, and gave him [to be] the head over all [things] to the church,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And you [hath he quickened], who were dead in trespasses and sins;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherein in time past ye walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Among whom also we all had our conversation in times past in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind; and were by nature the children of wrath, even as others.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God, who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by grace ye are saved;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: And hath raised [us] up together, and made [us] sit together in heavenly [places] in Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That in the ages to come he might shew the exceeding riches of his grace in [his] kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: [it is] the gift of God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not of works, lest any man should boast.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore remember, that ye [being] in time past Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called the Circumcision in the flesh made by hands;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now in Christ Jesus ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition [between us];

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having abolished in his flesh the enmity, [even] the law of commandments [contained] in ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, [so] making peace;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that he might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross, having slain the enmity thereby:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And came and preached peace to you which were afar off, and to them that were nigh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner [stone];

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom ye also are builded together for an habitation of God through the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,

Author: Paul
Sentence: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:

Author: Paul
Sentence: How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of his power.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to make all [men] see what [is] the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly [places] might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God,

Author: Paul
Sentence: According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,

Author: Paul
Sentence: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,

Author: Paul
Sentence: May be able to comprehend with all saints what [is] the breadth, and length, and depth, and height;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Unto him [be] glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,

Author: Paul
Sentence: With all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, forbearing one another in love;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [There is] one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling;

Author: Paul
Sentence: One Lord, one faith, one baptism,

Author: Paul
Sentence: One God and Father of all, who [is] above all, and through all, and in you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that he might fill all things.)

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That we [henceforth] be no more children, tossed to and fro, and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the sleight of men, [and] cunning craftiness, whereby they lie in wait to deceive;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But speaking the truth in love, may grow up into him in all things, which is the head, [even] Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: From whom the whole body fitly joined together and compacted by that which every joint supplieth, according to the effectual working in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye henceforth walk not as other Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having the understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who being past feeling have given themselves over unto lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But ye have not so learned Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: If so be that ye have heard him, and have been taught by him, as the truth is in Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that ye put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither give place to the devil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with [his] hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now [are ye] light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For the fruit of the Spirit [is] in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove [them].

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

Author: Paul
Sentence: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord [is].

Author: Paul
Sentence: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so [let] the wives [be] to their own husbands in every thing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

Author: Paul
Sentence: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife [see] that she reverence [her] husband.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Servants, be obedient to them that are [your] masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;

Author: Paul
Sentence: With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether [he be] bond or free.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening: knowing that your Master also is in heaven; neither is there respect of persons with him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high [places].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

Author: Paul
Sentence: For which I am an ambassador in bonds: that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But that ye also may know my affairs, [and] how I do, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and [that] he might comfort your hearts.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Peace [be] to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheus [our] brother,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love [which ye have] to all the saints,

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which is come unto you, as [it is] in all the world; and bringeth forth fruit, as [it doth] also in you, since the day ye heard [of it], and knew the grace of God in truth:

Author: Paul
Sentence: As ye also learned of Epaphras our dear fellowservant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause we also, since the day we heard [it], do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Strengthened with all might, according to his glorious power, unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated [us] into the kingdom of his dear Son:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom we have redemption through his blood, [even] the forgiveness of sins:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For by him were all things created, that are in heaven, and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether [they be] thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he is before all things, and by him all things consist.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all [things] he might have the preeminence.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it pleased [the Father] that in him should all fulness dwell;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, having made peace through the blood of his cross, by him to reconcile all things unto himself; by him, [I say], whether [they be] things in earth, or things in heaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And you, that were sometime alienated and enemies in [your] mind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If ye continue in the faith grounded and settled, and [be] not moved away from the hope of the gospel, which ye have heard, [and] which was preached to every creature which is under heaven; whereof I Paul am made a minister;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body’s sake, which is the church:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereof I am made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given to me for you, to fulfil the word of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Even] the mystery which hath been hid from ages and from generations, but now is made manifest to his saints:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To whom God would make known what [is] the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whom we preach, warning every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereunto I also labour, striving according to his working, which worketh in me mightily.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, and [for] them at Laodicea, and [for] as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, [so] walk ye in him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Buried with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with [him] through the faith of the operation of God, who hath raised him from the dead.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross;

Author: Paul
Sentence: [And] having spoiled principalities and powers, he made a shew of them openly, triumphing over them in it.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath [days]:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which are a shadow of things to come; but the body [is] of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,

Author: Paul
Sentence: (Touch not; taste not; handle not;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body; not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When Christ, [who is] our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For which things’ sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And have put on the new [man], which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond [nor] free: but Christ [is] all, and in all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also [do] ye.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And above all these things [put on] charity, which is the bond of perfectness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, [do] all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Husbands, love [your] wives, and be not bitter against them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Children, obey [your] parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Fathers, provoke not your children [to anger], lest they be discouraged.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Servants, obey in all things [your] masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And whatsoever ye do, do [it] heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Masters, give unto [your] servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let your speech [be] alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you, [who is] a beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;

Author: Paul
Sentence: With Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is [one] of you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: They shall make known unto you all things which [are done] here.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you, and Marcus, sister’s son to Barnabas, (touching whom ye received commandments: if he come unto you, receive him;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: And Jesus, which is called Justus, who are of the circumcision.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These only [are my] fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, which have been a comfort unto me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Epaphras, who is [one] of you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them [that are] in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the [epistle] from Laodicea.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The salutation by the hand of me Paul.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Remember my bonds.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;

Author: Paul
Sentence: So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure:

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Which is] a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing [it is] a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,

Author: Paul
Sentence: In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;

Author: Paul
Sentence: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of [this] calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of [his] goodness, and the work of faith with power:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and [by] our gathering together unto him,

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man deceive you by any means: for [that day shall not come], except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth [will let], until he be taken out of the way.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Even him], whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given [us] everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have [free] course, and be glorified, even as [it is] with you:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all [men] have not faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep [you] from evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither did we eat any man’s bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yet count [him] not as an enemy, but admonish [him] as a brother.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Lord [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, [which is] our hope;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Unto Timothy, [my] own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: [so do].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, and [of] a good conscience, and [of] faith unfeigned:

Author: Paul
Sentence: From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we know that the law [is] good, if a man use it lawfully;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;

Author: Paul
Sentence: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I did [it] ignorantly in unbelief.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This [is] a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, [be] honour and glory for ever and ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, [and] giving of thanks, be made for all men;

Author: Paul
Sentence: For kings, and [for] all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this [is] good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [there is] one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, [and] lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This [is] a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

Author: Paul
Sentence: A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;

Author: Paul
Sentence: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Likewise [must] the deacons [be] grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being [found] blameless.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even so [must their] wives [be] grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Forbidding to marry, [and commanding] to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For every creature of God [is] good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself [rather] unto godliness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This [is] a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These things command and teach.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Rebuke not an elder, but intreat [him] as a father; [and] the younger men as brethren;

Author: Paul
Sentence: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints’ feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And withal they learn [to be] idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, The labourer [is] worthy of his reward.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I charge [thee] before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins: keep thyself pure.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thine often infirmities.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Some men’s sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some [men] they follow after.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Likewise also the good works [of some] are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and [his] doctrine be not blasphemed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise [them], because they are brethren; but rather do [them] service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These things teach and exhort.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, [even] the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we brought nothing into [this] world, [and it is] certain we can carry nothing out.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and [into] many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and [before] Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That thou keep [this] commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which in his times he shall shew, [who is] the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom [be] honour and power everlasting.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane [and] vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which some professing have erred concerning the faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To Timothy, [my] dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I thank God, whom I serve from [my] forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

Author: Paul
Sentence: When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who hath saved us, and called [us] with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

Author: Paul
Sentence: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found [me].

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of [this] life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if a man also strive for masteries, [yet] is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, [even] unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It is] a faithful saying: For if we be dead with [him], we shall also live with [him]:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If we suffer, we shall also reign with [him]: if we deny [him], he also will deny us:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If we believe not, [yet] he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of these things put [them] in remembrance, charging [them] before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, [but] to the subverting of the hearers.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But shun profane [and] vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master’s use, [and] prepared unto every good work.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all [men], apt to teach, patient,

Author: Paul
Sentence: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And [that] they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all [men], as theirs also was.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of [them] all the Lord delivered me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned [them];

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All scripture [is] given by inspiration of God, and [is] profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I charge [thee] therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they shall turn away [their] ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I have fought a good fight, I have finished [my] course, I have kept the faith:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Only Luke is with me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring [with thee], and the books, [but] especially the parchments.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

Author: Paul
Sentence: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all [men] forsook me: [I pray God] that it may not be laid to their charge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and [that] all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve [me] unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom [be] glory for ever and ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do thy diligence to come before winter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Lord Jesus Christ [be] with thy spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To Titus, [mine] own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

Author: Paul
Sentence: One of themselves, [even] a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians [are] alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This witness is true.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Unto the pure all things [are] pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving [is] nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

Author: Paul
Sentence: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny [him], being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The aged women likewise, that [they be] in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

Author: Paul
Sentence: [To be] discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine [shewing] uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Exhort] servants to be obedient unto their own masters, [and] to please [them] well in all [things]; not answering again;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man despise thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, [but] gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, [and] hating one another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [This is] a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These things are good and profitable unto men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All that are with me salute thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet them that love us in the faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Hath in these last days spoken unto us by [his] Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who being the brightness of [his] glory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For unto which of the angels said he at any time, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And of the angels he saith, Who maketh his angels spirits, and his ministers a flame of fire.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But unto the Son [he saith], Thy throne, O God, [is] for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness [is] the sceptre of thy kingdom.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, [even] thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:

Author: Paul
Sentence: They shall perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let [them] slip.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;

Author: Paul
