Sentence: How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard [him];

Author: Paul
Sentence: God also bearing [them] witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing [that is] not put under him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now we see not yet all things put under him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it became him, for whom [are] all things, and by whom [are] all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified [are] all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, I will put my trust in him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For verily he took not on [him the nature of] angels; but he took on [him] the seed of Abraham.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto [his] brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things [pertaining] to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses [was faithful] in all his house.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this [man] was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For every house is builded by some [man]; but he that built all things [is] God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And Moses verily [was] faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

Author: Paul
Sentence: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in [their] heart; and they have not known my ways.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;

Author: Paul
Sentence: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But with whom was he grieved forty years?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [was it] not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left [us] of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard [it].

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he spake in a certain place of the seventh [day] on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And in this [place] again, If they shall enter into my rest.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God [did] from his.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the word of God [is] quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and [is] a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things [are] naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast [our] profession.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as [we are, yet] without sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things [pertaining] to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as [was] Aaron.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son, to day have I begotten thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As he saith also in another [place], Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which [be] the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For every one that useth milk [is] unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, [even] those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And this will we do, if God permit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [it is] impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,

Author: Paul
Sentence: If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put [him] to an open shame.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But that which beareth thorns and briers [is] rejected, and [is] nigh unto cursing; whose end [is] to be burned.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God [is] not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation [is] to them an end of all strife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed [it] by an oath:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That by two immutable things, in which [it was] impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which [hope] we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whither the forerunner is for us entered, [even] Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now consider how great this man [was], unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And here men that die receive tithes; but there he [receiveth them], of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need [was there] that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [it is] evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he testifieth, Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope [did]; by the which we draw nigh unto God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And inasmuch as not without an oath [he was made priest]:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

Author: Paul
Sentence: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But this [man], because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For such an high priest became us, [who is] holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people’s: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, [maketh] the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now of the things which we have spoken [this is] the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;

Author: Paul
Sentence: A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore [it is] of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, [that] thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if that first [covenant] had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this [is] the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In that he saith, A new [covenant], he hath made the first old.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now that which decayeth and waxeth old [is] ready to vanish away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Then verily the first [covenant] had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein [was] the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein [was] the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service [of God].

Author: Paul
Sentence: But into the second [went] the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and [for] the errors of the people:

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which [was] a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Which stood] only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed [on them] until the time of reformation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption [for us].

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:

Author: Paul
Sentence: How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions [that were] under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For where a testament [is], there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For a testament [is] of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whereupon neither the first [testament] was dedicated without blood.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Saying, This [is] the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It was] therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, [which are] the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;

Author: Paul
Sentence: For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:

Author: Paul
Sentence: So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, [and] not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For then would they not have ceased to be offered?

Author: Paul
Sentence: because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But in those [sacrifices there is] a remembrance again [made] of sins every year.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [it is] not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In burnt offerings and [sacrifices] for sin thou hast had no pleasure.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and [offering] for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure [therein]; which are offered by the law;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once [for all].

Author: Paul
Sentence: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Whereof] the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

Author: Paul
Sentence: This [is] the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now where remission of these [is, there is] no more offering for sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,

Author: Paul
Sentence: By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And [having] an high priest over the house of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us hold fast the profession of [our] faith without wavering; (for he [is] faithful that promised;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some [is]; but exhorting [one another]: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

Author: Paul
Sentence: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that despised Moses’ law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we know him that hath said, Vengeance [belongeth] unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It is] a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the just shall live by faith: but if [any man] draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For by it the elders obtained a good report.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But without faith [it is] impossible to please [him]: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and [that] he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as [in] a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker [is] God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, [so many] as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.

Author: Paul
Sentence: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of [them], and embraced [them], and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And truly, if they had been mindful of that [country] from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now they desire a better [country], that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten [son],

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Accounting that God [was] able to raise [him] up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, [leaning] upon the top of his staff.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw [he was] a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry [land]: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And what shall I more say?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and [of] Barak, and [of] Samson, and [of] Jephthae; [of] David also, and Samuel, and [of] the prophets:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And others had trial of [cruel] mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

Author: Paul
Sentence: They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;

Author: Paul
Sentence: (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and [in] mountains, and [in] dens and caves of the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

Author: Paul
Sentence: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset [us], and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of [our] faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected [us], and we gave [them] reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they verily for a few days chastened [us] after their own pleasure; but he for [our] profit, that [we] might be partakers of his holiness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Follow peace with all [men], and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble [you], and thereby many be defiled;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lest there [be] any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which [voice] they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And so terrible was the sight, [that] Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)

Author: Paul
Sentence: But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than [that of] Abel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more [shall not] we [escape], if we turn away from him that [speaketh] from heaven:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And this [word], Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For our God [is] a consuming fire.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let brotherly love continue.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; [and] them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Marriage [is] honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Let your] conversation [be] without covetousness; [and be] content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So that we may boldly say, The Lord [is] my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of [their] conversation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [it is] a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of [our] lips giving thanks to his name.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that [is] unprofitable for you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I beseech [you] the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom [be] glory for ever and ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye that [our] brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints.

Author: Paul
Sentence: They of Italy salute you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

Author: Peter
Sentence: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that [pertain] unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make [you that ye shall] neither [be] barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

Author: Peter
Sentence: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know [them], and be established in the present truth.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting [you] in remembrance;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Knowing that shortly I must put off [this] my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

Author: Peter
Sentence: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake [as they were] moved by the Holy Ghost.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast [them] down to hell, and delivered [them] into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth [person], a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned [them] with an overthrow, making [them] an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:

Author: Peter
Sentence: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed [his] righteous soul from day to day with [their] unlawful deeds;)

Author: Peter
Sentence: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:

Author: Peter
Sentence: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Presumptuous [are they], selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, [as] they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Spots [they are] and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaam [the son] of Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;

Author: Peter
Sentence: But was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with man’s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.

Author: Peter
Sentence: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For when they speak great swelling [words] of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, [through much] wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.

Author: Peter
Sentence: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they have known [it], to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog [is] turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.

Author: Peter
Sentence: This second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you; in [both] which I stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance:

Author: Peter
Sentence: That ye may be mindful of the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us the apostles of the Lord and Saviour:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

Author: Peter
Sentence: And saying, Where is the promise of his coming?

Author: Peter
Sentence: for since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as [they were] from the beginning of the creation.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For this they willingly are ignorant of, that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:

Author: Peter
Sentence: But the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day [is] with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Author: Peter
Sentence: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

Author: Peter
Sentence: [Seeing] then [that] all these things shall be dissolved, what manner [of persons] ought ye to be in [all] holy conversation and godliness,

Author: Peter
Sentence: Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?

Author: Peter
Sentence: Nevertheless we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And account [that] the longsuffering of our Lord [is] salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also according to the wisdom given unto him hath written unto you;

Author: Peter
Sentence: As also in all [his] epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are some things hard to be understood, which they that are unlearned and unstable wrest, as [they do] also the other scriptures, unto their own destruction.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing ye know [these things] before, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own stedfastness.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But grow in grace, and [in] the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: To him [be] glory both now and for ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Amen.
